title: Man Utd make Erling Braut Haaland top transfer target but face Real Madrid competition
text:

Manchester United have reportedly identified Red Bull Salzburg hotshot Erling Braut Haaland as their 'primary target' next summer - but will face fierce competition from Real Madrid .

The 19-year-old has scored a remarkable 18 goals in 11 appearances this season, and after a recent illness, he climbed off the bench to notch Salzburg's equaliser in this month's Champions League clash with Liverpool at Anfield, which the Reds ultimately went on to win 4-3.

Before that impressive performance, Norwegian Haaland scored his third hat-trick of the season in Salzburg's 6-2 victory over Genk on Matchday 1 of the Champions League last month.

That form has led interest from Europe's big guns, with Spanish publication AS claiming that Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has made the teenager his top target ahead of next season.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

However United will face a battle with Madrid, who are also believed to be keen on bringing him to the Bernabeu.

It is claimed that Haaland 'fits like a glove' as Madrid are keen on finding a long-term replacement for Karim Benzema, who turns 31 in December.

Meanwhile Haaland says he is "bored" of the speculation linking him with a move to Manchester United among other clubs.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

“The media attention is huge. It’s good pressure," he said in quotes carried by Sport Witness . “The club is good at shielding me a little, but I hope it will be more shielding in the future.

"It will be difficult, but we will try. I want to be shielded. It’s boring. I’m bored now. On a scale of 1 to 10 [of how bored]? 9.9.”

Haaland followed in the footsteps of his dad Alf Inge when he scored against Liverpool at Anfield, with Haaland senior doing so for Leeds United in a 3-1 defeat to the Reds on Boxing Day 1997, before his son was even born.
description: Europe's big guns are keeping tabs on Erling Braut Haaland, who has been in stunning form for Red Bull Salzburg this season
